app_description: This service allows you to convert a braille-ready file from one braille encoding to another. A braille encoding is a character set used to represent braille patterns in digital form. Historically, different countries, and even different printing houses within the same country, use different character sets when preparing texts for embossing in braille. This is largely due to the equipment used, as well as the peculiarities of a specific alphabet. This tool is designed to solve the problem of incompatibility of Braille encodings when it is necessary to emboss a file prepared for the equipment of one printing house on the equipment of another one, or to read this file using a braille display.
opt_chtenie_1: "CHTENIE" Publishing House of All-Russia Society of the blind braille encoding
opt_chtenie_2: "CHTENIE" Publishing House of All-Russia Society of the blind braille encoding
